content:
I like this article by Matthew Tift, whom I consider a friend and mentor.
https://www.lullabot.com/articles/using-drupal-pandemic

I think Matthew would agree that much of what he says applies to open source in general and certainly to the Backdrop CMS community.

Using Drupal in a Pandemic | Lullabot
As we negotiate a world where COVID-19 dominates the headlines and our daily lives, considering lessons from the Drupal community might shape our understanding of these extraordinary times.

This stuff is scarier by the hour almost. As I said in another thread I still sort of have a job, however I'm not supposed to do any of it. The city has money budgeted until October so I don't really foresee anything changing until then. It is worrying though. On the positive side, I have what I've desired for the last couple of years. I have time now. I don't really know any any of you folks, but I might be asking for advice in the coming months anyway.
@Justin Keiser we're here to help however we can.
